author: Ivan Kravets

content.title: Choosing Bad Competition | Greylock

text:
Recently, I stumbled upon an engaging podcast where Reid Hoffman shares valuable insights on identifying untapped markets with bad competition. It struck me how his discussion resonated with the #EmbeddedSystems market and its prevailing oligopoly. In fact, Reid's three-category classification presents an excellent framework to validate your #BusinessStrategy, particularly when you recognize the need for industry reinvention.

Another fascinating aspect I've noticed is the increasing number of silicon vendors venturing into new solutions inspired by the resounding success of PlatformIO and the Microsoft VSCode editor. However, regrettably, many of these vendors have fallen short of their original marketing objectives due to a lack of understanding about the key factors driving our business strategy — the power to provide developers with choices. 

At PlatformIO Labs, we have consciously chosen not to invest in code editors and have built our business on a foundation that empowers developers with options. While other companies, such as Microsoft and JetBrains, excel in this domain, it is worth highlighting the inherent risks associated with such endeavors, including licensing issues and the ever-evolving landscape of editor preferences.

Let's continue to embrace Reid's guidance and explore how we can redefine markets, inspire innovation, and empower developers to shape the future of embedded systems. Together, we can navigate these challenges and unlock remarkable opportunities! 🚀 

👉 https://lnkd.in/dkifgV-n
📌 #Technology #Innovation #Business #BusinessStrategy #MarketReinvention #Marketing #DeveloperEmpowerment #Semiconductor #Future
